title: Anxiety Disorders — Overview
description: Educational overview of anxiety disorders, including common symptoms and how anxiety can impact daily life.

title: Generalized Anxiety Disorder (GAD)
description: Learn about persistent worry, physical symptoms, and treatment options used for generalized anxiety disorder.

title: Panic Disorder
description: Explains panic attacks, panic disorder, risk factors, and commonly used treatments.

title: Social Anxiety Disorder
description: Educational information about fear of social situations, avoidance, and treatment approaches.

title: Specific Phobias
description: Overview of phobias, how they differ from everyday fears, and evidence-based treatment options.

title: Depression — Overview
description: Educational overview of depression, symptoms, and treatment options, including psychotherapy and medications.

title: Major Depressive Disorder (MDD)
description: Common signs, causes, risk factors, and clinical treatment approaches for major depression.

title: Persistent Depressive Disorder (Dysthymia)
description: Explains long-lasting depression symptoms and common treatment approaches.

title: Seasonal Affective Disorder (SAD)
description: Learn about seasonal patterns in mood changes and common treatments like light therapy and psychotherapy.

title: Depression in Children and Adolescents
description: Educational information on depression symptoms in youth and when to seek professional evaluation.

title: Bipolar Disorder — Overview
description: Explains episodes of mania/hypomania and depression, and common treatment planning approaches.

title: Bipolar I Disorder
description: Learn about manic episodes, symptoms, and how clinicians evaluate and treat bipolar I disorder.

title: Bipolar II Disorder
description: Educational info about hypomanic episodes and depressive episodes and how treatment differs from bipolar I.

title: Schizophrenia — Overview
description: Explains symptoms (including hallucinations and delusions), treatment, and support considerations.

title: Psychosis — Signs and Symptoms
description: Learn what psychosis can look like and why professional evaluation matters.

title: Early Warning Signs of Psychosis
description: Educational guide on possible early changes in thinking, perception, and behavior.

title: Obsessive-Compulsive Disorder (OCD) — Overview
description: Explains obsessions and compulsions, and evidence-based treatments such as ERP and medication.

title: Body Dysmorphic Disorder (BDD)
description: Educational information about preoccupation with perceived appearance flaws and treatment approaches.

title: Hoarding Disorder
description: Explains difficulty discarding items, distress, and common therapy-based treatment approaches.

title: Post-Traumatic Stress Disorder (PTSD) — Overview
description: Educational overview of PTSD symptoms, risk factors, and evidence-based treatments.

title: Trauma — Understanding Responses
description: Explains how trauma can affect the brain and body, and why reactions can differ across people.

title: Complex PTSD (C-PTSD) — Information
description: Educational overview of long-term trauma effects and common recovery-focused treatment approaches.

title: Eating Disorders — Overview
description: Explains types of eating disorders, warning signs, and why early support matters.

title: Anorexia Nervosa
description: Educational information about symptoms, risks, and treatment options for anorexia nervosa.

title: Bulimia Nervosa
description: Explains binge/purge behaviors, health risks, and clinical treatment approaches for bulimia.

title: Binge-Eating Disorder
description: Educational overview of binge-eating disorder and evidence-based treatments.

title: ADHD — Overview
description: Explains attention-deficit/hyperactivity disorder, including symptoms and treatment options across ages.

title: Autism Spectrum Disorder (ASD) — Overview
description: Educational information about autism, including communication differences and supports.

title: Learning Disorders — Information
description: Overview of learning disorders and how evaluation and educational supports can help.

title: Substance Use and Mental Health — Overview
description: Explains how substance use can relate to mental health and where to find trustworthy information.

title: Alcohol Use Disorder
description: Educational information about alcohol use disorder signs, risks, and treatment approaches.

title: Opioid Use Disorder — Information
description: Overview of opioid use disorder, risks, and treatment options including medications for OUD.

title: Sleep and Mental Health
description: Explains how sleep affects mood, stress, and mental well-being, including practical sleep health guidance.

title: Insomnia — Overview
description: Educational overview of insomnia symptoms, causes, and treatment options including CBT-I.

title: Grief and Bereavement — Understanding the Process
description: Learn how grief can affect emotions and daily life, and what support can look like over time.

title: Complicated Grief — Information
description: Educational overview of prolonged grief responses and when professional support may help.

title: Stress — Effects and Coping
description: Explains how stress affects mind and body and offers evidence-based coping strategies.

title: Burnout — Signs and Prevention
description: Educational information about burnout symptoms, risk factors, and prevention strategies.

title: Workplace Mental Health — Overview
description: Information on workplace mental health and strategies that can support well-being on the job.

title: Self-Harm — Understanding and Warning Signs
description: Educational overview of self-harm, common warning signs, and supportive ways to talk about it.

title: Suicide Warning Signs and Prevention
description: Learn warning signs and prevention information. For immediate help, call local emergency services.

title: How to Talk About Suicide (Educational)
description: Guidance on safe, supportive conversations and why asking directly can matter.

title: Personality Disorders — Overview
description: Educational overview of personality disorders, common patterns, and treatment approaches.

title: Borderline Personality Disorder (BPD)
description: Explains symptoms, emotional regulation challenges, and evidence-based therapies like DBT.

title: Dissociative Disorders — Overview
description: Educational information about dissociation and dissociative disorders, including common features.

title: Pediatric Mental Health — Overview
description: General information on children’s mental health and how families can support healthy development.

title: Anxiety in Children
description: Educational information about anxiety symptoms in children and when to consider professional help.

title: Behavior and Conduct Problems
description: Information on behavior challenges in youth and supportive approaches that can help.

title: Perinatal Depression (Postpartum Depression)
description: Educational information about mood changes during and after pregnancy and common treatment options.

title: Anxiety During Pregnancy and Postpartum
description: Overview of anxiety symptoms in the perinatal period and how support and treatment may help.

title: Anger — Healthy Expression and Coping
description: Educational guidance on anger triggers, regulation skills, and when anger becomes a problem.

title: Emotion Regulation Skills (DBT-Informed)
description: High-level overview of emotion regulation strategies commonly taught in skills-based therapies.

title: Therapy — Types and What to Expect
description: Educational overview of psychotherapy types (CBT, DBT, ACT, etc.) and what sessions can be like.

title: Cognitive Behavioral Therapy (CBT) — Overview
description: Explains CBT basics and how it targets thoughts, feelings, and behaviors.

title: Dialectical Behavior Therapy (DBT) — Overview
description: Educational overview of DBT and how skills like distress tolerance and emotion regulation are taught.

title: Exposure Therapy — Basics
description: Explains exposure therapy principles, commonly used for anxiety disorders and phobias.

title: Stigma and Mental Health
description: Educational information about stigma, how it affects help-seeking, and ways communities can reduce it.

title: How to Support Someone with a Mental Health Condition
description: Practical educational tips for supportive conversations and encouraging professional help when needed.

title: Panic Attacks — What They Are
description: Explains what panic attacks feel like and how they differ from other medical conditions.

title: Health Anxiety — Overview
description: Educational overview of persistent worry about health and when it becomes clinically significant.

title: Schizoaffective Disorder — Information
description: Educational overview of symptoms that combine mood episode features and psychosis.

title: Delusional Disorder — Overview
description: Educational information about delusional disorder, including evaluation and treatment approaches.

title: Somatic Symptom Disorder — Information
description: Explains persistent physical symptoms linked with significant distress and common treatment approaches.

title: Adjustment Disorders
description: Educational overview of emotional/behavioral symptoms following a stressful life change or event.

title: Pediatric ADHD — School Support
description: Information on ADHD supports in school settings and how accommodations may help.

title: What Is Mental Health? (Foundations)
description: Foundational educational overview of mental health and mental disorders, including common myths and facts.

title: Mental Health Conditions — A-Z (Educational Index)
description: A broad educational index of mental health conditions and topics to support learning and awareness.

title: Mindfulness and Mental Well-Being
description: Educational overview of mindfulness practices and how they can support stress reduction and well-being.

title: Exercise and Mental Health
description: How physical activity supports mood and stress regulation, with practical guidance for getting started.

title: NAMI — National Alliance on Mental Illness
description: The nation's largest grassroots mental health organization with local chapters nationwide. Use their 'Find Your Local NAMI' tool to connect with support groups, education programs, and advocacy in your community.

title: Mental Health America — Local Affiliates
description: Community-based non-profit with over 200 affiliates across the country. Find local mental health services, support groups, and community programs through their affiliate locator.

title: Crisis Text Line
description: Free, 24/7 text-based mental health support. Text HOME to 741741 to connect with a trained crisis counselor. Available nationwide with volunteer counselors in every state.

title: The Trevor Project
description: Leading national organization providing crisis intervention and suicide prevention for LGBTQ+ young people. Offers 24/7 phone, text, and chat support.

title: SAMHSA Treatment Locator
description: Find mental health and substance use treatment facilities near you. Enter your zip code to locate community mental health centers, counseling services, and treatment programs in your area.

title: 988 Suicide & Crisis Lifeline
description: Free, confidential 24/7 support for people in emotional distress or suicidal crisis. Call or text 988 to connect with local crisis center counselors across the country.

title: Active Minds
description: Non-profit empowering students to speak openly about mental health. Find or start a chapter at your school to promote mental wellness and peer support on campus.

title: To Write Love on Her Arms
description: Non-profit movement dedicated to presenting hope and finding help for people struggling with depression, addiction, self-injury, and suicide. Offers a treatment finder and community resources.

title: Community Wellness Center — Example
description: Sample local counseling center offering sliding-scale therapy, support groups, and community workshops. This demonstrates how local resources appear in the directory.

title: Youth Mental Health Support Group — Example
description: Sample peer support group for teens dealing with anxiety and depression. Meets weekly at local community center. Example of community-based support programming.

title: Mental Health Awareness Walk — Example Event
description: Sample annual community event raising awareness and funds for local mental health services. Example of community programming and events.
